line.text: Lo in the orient when the gracious light
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Lifts up his burning head each under eye
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Doth homage to his new-appearing sight
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Serving with looks his sacred majesty
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And having climbed the steep-up heavenly hill
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Resembling strong youth in his middle age
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Yet mortal looks adore his beauty still
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But when from highmost pitch with weary car
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Like feeble age he reeleth from the day
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: The eyes (fore duteous) now converted are
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: From his low tract and look another way
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: So thou thy self out-going in thy noon
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Unlooked on diest unless thou get a son
